intro: Dracaena mannii, commonly known as the red-edged dracaena, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a slow-growing evergreen shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 10 meters in its natural habitat. The plant is characterized by its long, narrow, dark green leaves with striking red or purple margins. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers followed by red berries, which are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Dracaena mannii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor environments.
